text.value: Now lets make a hash chain (almost but not quite a block chain). As we have adjusted the files we now have a new version of the tree with a new hash. To track this change we add together the new tree hash and a previous commit hash, then hash that number again to get a 'commit hash'. We have made the first commit hash 0 to simplify things.
If necessary drag and drop the commit chain below into the correct order.
Commit hash 0 should be at the beginning, then add the previous commit to the new tree hash and hash the combination to create the new commit hash.
